Package com.foreach.across.modules.web.config.support

Class PrefixingHandlerMappingConfiguration

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.web.config.support.PrefixingHandlerMappingConfiguration
public abstract class PrefixingHandlerMappingConfiguration extends Object
Base class for configuration of a PrefixingRequestMappingHandlerMapping instance that supports customizing its configuration through one or more PrefixingHandlerMappingConfigurer instances.

Final configuration is done once after context bootstrap.

Implementations should override controllerHandlerMapping() method, and annotate it correctly for the bean to be created. Usually this means adding @Bean(name="BEAN_NAME") and @Exposed.

Author:
Arne Vandamme

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_ORDER_OFFSET

      public static final int DEFAULT_ORDER_OFFSET
      Default order of the fallback handler mapping is 0. Prefixing mappings should come before that, preferably in module order. The offset is the number that is subtracted from the module index.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values
